result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany M. Marvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 56 days if revoked.
Court will not object transferring probation to Michigan if requested.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided.
Completion of AODA and follow through with any recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed beneficial by agent.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany M. Marvin

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 27, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Sentencing After Revocation Packet
Routed to Judge's JA

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission

9:05 AM in Room 301. Defendant Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Brittany M. Marvin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. can hear and consents to proceeding by Zoom. State recites agreement. Def. to plead to Ct. 1 and 2. Ct. 3 to be DRI. Joint recommendation. Ct. 1 - withhold sentence, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, DNA sample, AODA and follow thru, maintain abs. sob. maintain fulltime employment, counseling as deemed necessary. Does not object to probation being transferred to Michigan. Ct. 2 -  1 year jail, imp/stayed, concurrent, 4 years probation, costs inc. DNA surcharge, comply with conditions in Ct. 1.  Agreeable to early discharge after three years if no rule violations. Attny Zich in agreement. Def. agrees with terms. Plea questionnaire reviewed.
Def pleads to Ct. 1 - Poss of Meth, repeater, no contest; Ct. 2 - Poss of THC, 2nd, repeater, no contest. The Court grants State's motion to DRI Ct. 3. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed.  Attny Zich is satisfied. The Court finds Def. understands and that plea is freely and voluntarily given. The Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. Sentencing remarks by State. Sentencing remarks by Attny Zich. Def. makes statement. Remarks by the Court.          .
The Court will abide by recommendation, orders 
 Ct. 1 - withhold sentence, 4 years probation, costs only with DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, completion AODA and follow thru with any recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain fulltime employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed beneficial by agent.
Ct. 2 -  1 year jail, imp/stayed, Huber, 4 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, comply with conditions in Ct. 1. Will not object transferring probation to Michigan if requested. 
Firearm/voting rights. Post conviction rights. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
 $2,500 cash bond to be put toward fine/costs, remainder to be returned to poster. 
Credit: 56 days if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:34 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in court with attorney John Zich, via zoom.  Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in custody, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Bond poster is also in courtroom. State ask the bail/bond continue to follow. Atty Zich does not object.  Court will delay ruling of bail/bond forfeiture. N.H. bond poster makes statement. Court will delay ruling. Bond continues.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:29 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in court, in custody. Attorney Fehrenbach appears in court for defendant. Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Fehrenbach makes statement and waives preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and goes over waiver of rights for a preliminary hearing. Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing was signed by defendant and given to the clerk to file. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Attorney Gebert makes statement to proceed in arraignment. Attorney Fehrenbach agrees and pleas not guilty to all counts. Court orders clerk to enter pleas into record. A status conference is scheduled May 23, 2022 at 11:00am. Attorney Fehrenbach and Attorney Gebert has no questions for the court. Defendant has no questions for the court. Court is adjourned.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:38 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Court vacates warrant.  Def. explains why missed court. State gives bail/bond recommendation. $2,500 cash bond is in forfeiture proceeding and request $5,000 cash bond.  Court questions defendant.  Court orders $3,000 cash bond with conditions. Def. makes statement.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:04 PM Attorney John Zich in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Zich can't explain where def's whereabouts are.  State moves to forfeit bond, $5,000 or body, nationwide.  Court authorize $12,000 cash or body, nationwide. Court moves to forfeit bond pending hearing.

records.addlTxt: Acknowledgement by Bail Depositor
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and not to leave the state of Wisconsin.

01:09 PM Defendant Brittany M. Marvin in court, in custody. Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Brittany M. Marvin appeared by video means. All parties via Zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant will make a decision in the future regarding a public defender or an attorney. DA gives recommendation of a cash bond of $3,000 with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and is not to leave the state of Wisconsin. Defendant responds. Court makes statement. Attorney Gebert makes statement. Court orders a $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and not to leave the state of Wisconsin. An adjourned initial appearance is scheduled 4/18/22 at 1:30pm. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
